Package optimization

Class GradDescentBackTrack

java.lang.Object
java.util.concurrent.ForkJoinTask<double[]>
java.util.concurrent.RecursiveTask<double[]>
optimization.GradDescentBackTrack
All Implemented Interfaces:
Serializable, Future<double[]>
public class GradDescentBackTrack extends RecursiveTask<double[]>
Runs gradient descent back tracking.

  • Constructor Details

    • GradDescentBackTrack

      public GradDescentBackTrack(DiffReal f, double tolerance)
      Parameters:
      f - The function to be minimized. If this is stochastic, then the stochastic method should be implemented.
      tolerance - The smaller this is, the more accurate the result will

  • Method Details

    • jump

      protected org.jblas.DoubleMatrix jump(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix from, FuncAt atX)
      The backtracking portion of backtracking gradient descent. The method picks a point at some distance, and then reduces that distance by a factor of gamma until the value of f at that point is less than c * the slope at the given point.
      Parameters:
      from - The point we're jumping from.
      atX - The gradient of the from point.
      Returns:
      a new point along the direction of grad that has improved f more than the slope of grad times c.

    • compute

      public double[] compute()
      Finds the minimal value of the unconstrained function.
      Specified by:
      compute in class RecursiveTask<double[]>
      Returns:

    • atMin

      protected boolean atMin(org.jblas.DoubleMatrix grad)
      Is this the minimum point?
      Parameters:
      grad - The gradient of the point.
      Returns:
      True if this is a local minimum, false otherwise.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args)
      Tests the optimization method on a simple function.
      Parameters:
      args - No arguments are passed.
